Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Reverend Dr. John C.H. Chang, The Grace Christian Church, Flushing, 137-70 Northern Blvd. Flushing, N.Y.  11354.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Koo.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Reverend Dr. John C.H. Chang, The Grace Christian Church, Flushing, 137-70 Northern Boulevard, Flushing, N.Y. 11354.



Council Member Koo moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of December 20, 2010 and January 5, 2011 be adopted as printed by Council Member Barron.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Nelson actually moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 20, 2010 and Charter Meeting of January 5, 2011 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Reverend Diane Lacey, Council candidate for re-designation and subsequent re-appointment by the Mayor to the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors to serve for the remainder of a five-year term that will expire on March 20, 2014.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Reverend Diane Lacey, NYC Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Jackson:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-2269(g) or Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed/enclosed sidewalk café located at 233 Dyckman Street, Community Board 12, Application 20115231 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 233 Dyckman St, Manhattan (20115231TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Reyna:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-2269(g) or Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 152 Metropolitan Avenue, Community Board 1, Application 20115294 TCK shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 152 Metropolitan Ave, Brooklyn (20115294 TCK)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Reyna:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-2269(g) or Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 85 Broadway, Community Board 1, Application 20115165 TCK shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 85 Broadway, Brooklyn (20115165 TCK)

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Health

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting smoking in pedestrian plazas and public parks and to repeal subdivision b of section 17-513 of the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring a study regarding the prevention of second-hand smoke circulation in restaurants.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting smoking in pedestrian plazas and public parks.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution authorizing the Council to join in an amicus brief to be filed with the United States Supreme Court in support of the Respondents in the litigation captioned McComish v. Bennett, for the purpose of supporting the Respondents’ position that the Court should uphold the trigger funds provision of Arizona’s campaign finance law.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the Council to join in an amicus brief to be filed with the US Supreme Court in support of the Respondents in the litigation captioned McComish v. Bennett.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass legislation to authorize New York City to enact a local law to grant point credits for New York city resident applicants who pass the firefighter civil service exam and to establish eligibility criteria for such credits.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Authorize NYC to enact a local law to grant point credits for NYC resident applicants who pass the firefighter civil service exam and to establish eligibility criteria for such credits.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Secretary of the Department of Homeland Security to extend the Temporary Protected Status designation of Haiti and eligible Haitians, which is now set to expire on July 22, 2011.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Calling upon the Secretary of the Dept of Homeland Security to extend the Temporary Protected Status designation of Haiti and eligible Haitians, which is now set to expire on July 22, 2011.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to licensing and regulating furniture retail stores.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Licensing and regulating furniture retail stores.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring parking placards to have a barcode which would allow traffic enforcement agents to confirm their validity.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring parking placards to have a barcode which would allow traffic enforcement agents to confirm their validity.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to seizing pedicabs and suspending and/or revoking pedicab registration plates and drivers’ licenses for certain violations.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Seizing pedicabs and suspending and/or revoking pedicab registration plates and drivers’ licenses for certain violations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the permitted number of pedicab registration plates.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Permitted number of pedicab registration plates.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass, and the President to sign into law H.R. 3501 amending the Internal Revenue Service Code to permit a deduction of up to $3,500 in a taxable year for qualified pet care expenses.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass, and the President to sign into law H.R. 3501 amending the IRS Code to permit a deduction of up to $3,500 in a taxable year for qualified pet care expenses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a new parking permit for expectant mothers experiencing a difficult or complicated pregnancy.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Creating a new parking permit for expectant mothers experiencing a difficult or complicated pregnancy.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a Road Salt Task Force.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Creation of a Road Salt Task Force.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring property owners and the Department of Sanitation to use a salt substitute to remove snow or ice from streets, roadways and sidewalks.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring property owners and the Department of Sanitation to use a salt substitute to remove snow or ice from streets, roadways and sidewalks.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of Education to encourage eligible teen parents to enroll in the Living for the Young Family through Education (LYFE) program and to partner with the Administration for Children’s Services to develop additional parenting skills programs.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Dept of Education to encourage eligible teen parents to enroll in the Living for the Young Family through Education (LYFE) program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to eliminating the prearrangement and passenger manifest requirements for commuter vans.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Eliminating the prearrangement and passenger manifest requirements for commuter vans.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to submit reports concerning cardiopulmonary resuscitation and automated external defibrillator certification to the council.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the PD to submit reports concerning cardiopulmonary resuscitation and automated external defibrillator certification to the council.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend Section 156 of the Public Housing Law to grant priority status to all veterans of the United States military and their immediate families for admittance to public housing developments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: Amend Section 156 of the Public Housing Law to grant priority status to all veterans of the United States military and their immediate families for admittance to public housing developments.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to certain fees charged by the taxi and limousine commission.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Certain fees charged by the taxi and limousine commission.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass legislation that would bring early voting to the state.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to pass legislation that would bring early voting to the state.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring a cost benefit analysis prior to contracting out professional and standard services.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Requiring a cost benefit analysis prior to contracting out professional and standard services.
